snippet: On furlough days, the Federal Bureau of Investigation will have only a skeleton crew on hand, which raises questions about how effectively the agency can respond to crime.
abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation will shut down its headquarters and offices across country for about 10 weekdays over next year, in response to government spending cuts; on furlough days, it will have only a skeleton crew on hand, which raises questions about how effectively the agency can respond to crime.
lead_paragraph: On furlough days, the Federal Bureau of Investigation will have only a skeleton crew on hand, which raises questions about how effectively the agency can respond to crime.

headline.main: F.B.I. Plans to Close Offices for 10 Days to Cut Costs
headline.print_headline:
F.B.I. Offices
Set to Close
For 10 Days
